ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They said, 'Woe to us! We were indeed inordinate.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Saying: "Alas the woe, we were iniquitous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They said: “Woe to us! We had indeed transgressed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They said, "Woe to us. We have been arrogant.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: They said, “Woe to us – we were indeed rebellious.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: They said: "Woe to us! Verily, we were Taghin."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Said they: O woe to us! surely we were inordinate:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: They said, 'Woe, alas for us! Truly, we were insolent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: They said: Alas for us! In truth we were outrageous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: They said, "Alas for us, our behaviour was beyond the pale.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: They said: woe Unto us! verily we! we have been arrogant.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They said, ‘Woe to us! Indeed, we have been rebellious.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: They said: "Alas for us! We have indeed transgressed!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: They said: "Woe to us! Verily, we were Taghun (transgressors and disobedient, etc.)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: They said 'Woe to us, truly we were insolent'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They said, “Woe to us—we were indeed domineering.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: They said, "O woe to us; indeed we were transgressors.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [68:31] They said, ‘O ([yā is] for calling attention to something) woe to us!, [O] destruction of ours. We have indeed been unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (They said) in unison: (Alas for us! In truth we were outrageous) we were sinful by depriving the needy ones.
